info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 3:14PM EDT until June 1 at 2:55AM EDT by NWS State College PA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...
Swatara Creek at Harper Tavern affecting Lebanon and Schuylkill Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Swatara Creek at Harper Tavern.
* WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Several driveways and other minor roadways are affected. Water begins to enter some basements. At 10.0 feet, High water isolates several houses.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 9.83 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:15 PM EDT Saturday was 9.83 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage around midnight and continue falling to 3.1 feet early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.1 feet on 05/08/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Flooding is occurring. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late this evening.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT
